intro: Euryops anthemoides, commonly known as the golden coneflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces bright yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Euryops anthemoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
